elements.text: Python.jl

text: frankly, I'm inclined to accept `Python.jl`.  I'm not incredibly happy, but don't have many concrete arguments against it...

elements.text: Python.jl
frankly, I'm inclined to accept
Python.jl
.  I'm not incredibly happy, but don't have many concrete arguments against it...

text: I'm also not very happy, I think it's unfortunate and will confuse people, While Matlab.jl does exist, the community has settled on RCall, JavaCall Pycall etc as naming choices for the language interface projects. However, since we haven't written down a rule against it, I imagine we'll have to allow it.

elements.text: I'm also not very happy, I think it's unfortunate and will confuse people, While Matlab.jl does exist, the community has settled on RCall, JavaCall Pycall etc as naming choices for the language interface projects. However, since we haven't written down a rule against it, I imagine we'll have to allow it.

text: exactly, we don't have written rules..

elements.text: exactly, we don't have written rules..

text: `MATLAB.jl` is even given as a good example so :smile:

elements.text: MATLAB.jl
is even given as a good example so

text:
While the word Python is trademarked i believe this is a permitted us, as it is noncomercial and is similar to IronPython (which is listed as permitted)
<https://www.python.org/psf/trademarks/#the-word-python>

MATLAB.jl otoh, I think is not a good idea.
But maybe is also permitted?
They are less clear
<https://www.mathworks.com/content/dam/mathworks/mathworks-dot-com/support/books/members/pdfs/Trademark_Logo_Guidelines.pdf>
It does defininately have to be upper-case.
I guess we also have Gurobi.jl, CPLEX.jl etc

text: If it's a PyCall replacement, why not just `PyCall2.jl`? Avoids squatting on the name. For Gurobi and CPLEX (and other JuMP solvers), we have talked to the companies upstream, and they are happy for us to use the name. In the case of Mosek, we split into `MosekTools.jl`, and Mosek (the company) took over `Mosek.jl`

elements.text: If it's a PyCall replacement, why not just
PyCall2.jl
? Avoids squatting on the name. For Gurobi and CPLEX (and other JuMP solvers), we have talked to the companies upstream, and they are happy for us to use the name. In the case of Mosek, we split into

text: It is a different developer so it is a bit rude to take someone elses package name and slap a 2 on there, no?

elements.text: It is a different developer so it is a bit rude to take someone elses package name and slap a 2 on there, no?

text: MATLAB.jl and Python.jl are fairly clearly fair use (in the US at least): non-commercial, do not attempt to replace the correspondingly named entity, in fact to not function without out it. To make a trademark case, the argument would have to be that the names of these packages lead to consumer confusion between MATLAB and Matlab.jl and Python and Python.jl, respectively, which is a very big stretch that would be really hard to argue since you need to have each of the former in order for the latter to even work.

elements.text: MATLAB.jl and Python.jl are fairly clearly fair use (in the US at least): non-commercial, do not attempt to replace the correspondingly named entity, in fact to not function without out it. To make a trademark case, the argument would have to be that the names of these packages lead to consumer confusion between MATLAB and Matlab.jl and Python and Python.jl, respectively, which is a very big stretch that would be really hard to argue since you need to have each of the former in order for the latter to even work.
